channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Dow plummets over 1,800 points
item.description: The stocks mega-rally hit a roadblock: A somber economic outlook from the US Federal Reserve and the 2 millionth coronavirus case in the United States has investors questioning whether they had boosted the stock market too far, too fast.

item.title: America's top general apologizes for appearing in photo-op with Trump
item.description: America's top general is apologizing for appearing in a photo-op with President Donald Trump after the forceful dispersal of protesters outside the White House last week, saying the move was a "mistake."

item.title: Pence tweets, then deletes, photo of campaign staff
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence tweeted a photo showing a crowd of President Donald Trump's reelection campaign staff not wearing face masks or social distancing. The photo appeared to be from the campaign's Arlington, Virginia, office. Pence later deleted the tweet.

item.title: Trump says Covid-19 is reduced to 'ashes.' Data doesn't
Trump tries to stop probe of potential US war crimes by authorizing sanctions against ICC
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday authorized sanctions and additional visa restrictions against International Criminal Court personnel -- the latest attempt by the administration to strong-arm the international body out of an investigation into a potential war crimes by US military and intelligence officials.

item.title: 'Catastrophic' one-two punch from coronavirus and Brexit threatens UK
item.description: Britain is already heading for the worst coronavirus-induced slump of any major economy. Now fears are rising that businesses could be slammed by a second body blow this year — the failure of trade talks with the European Union.

item.title: EU to reopen external borders gradually from July
White House press secretary defends Trump's tweet
item.description: CNN's Abby Phillip says White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany's defense of President Donald Trump's tweet about a protester who was pushed over by police was "literally unbelievable" because there are no facts tied to it.

item.title: Trump's press secretary claims Juneteenth is a 'meaningful day' to him, but others see a racist play
Ex-officer charged in George Floyd's death is released on bond
item.description: One of the four former Minneapolis police officers awaiting trial in the death of George Floyd has been released on $750,000 bond.

item.title: White people are already experts on racism
item.description: When I knew him in the mid-1990s, Nick (as I'll call him here) bore a disconcerting resemblance to Dickie Greenleaf, the character played by Jude Law in "The Talented Mr. Ripley." He came from a wealthy New England family on Boston's North Shore; he'd been expelled from a dozen prep schools and barely graduated from college; he was effortlessly good at all sports and was the center of attention wherever he went.

item.title: Hear stunning question investor asked this black entrepreneur
item.description: Racial bias in the US can impact every aspect of life for a person of color, including their ability to start a business. CNN's Clare Sebastian reports.

item.title: GOP-led Senate panel authorizes subpoenas of top Obama officials
item.description: Director of National Intelligence John Ratcliffe declassified more documents Thursday and a Senate panel approved a wide-ranging authorization to subpoena former Obama administration officials as Republicans ratcheted up their efforts to scrutinize the origins of the FBI's investigation into Russia and President Donald Trump's team.

item.title: Two London police officers attacked in 'shocking' incident
item.description: Two London police officers have been attacked in an incident caught on film by members of the public, sparking condemnation from the UK's Home Secretary and the city's mayor.

item.title: See CNN's debut Electoral College map for the 2020 race
Biden 'absolutely convinced' military would escort Trump from White House if he loses and refuses to leave
item.description: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden said Wednesday he is "absolutely convinced" the military would escort President Donald Trump from the White House if he loses the election but refuses to leave office.

item.title: Trans activists call J.K. Rowling essay 'devastating'
item.description: Stars of the "Harry Potter" movie franchise have joined trans activists in standing with the transgender community after the publication of a lengthy essay by author J.K Rowling.

item.title: Expats buy Japanese country house for a song and get way more than they bargained for
item.description: Kimberly and Paul Fradale were living in Tokyo, working at international schools, when they took the leap many an American expat dreams of: buying a large country house for a song and restoring it to its former glory.

item.title: Restaurant owners given 723 years in prison for seafood scam
item.description: Two restaurant owners have been sentenced to 723 years in prison in Thailand, after defrauding the public with a seafood promotion.

item.title: Even Queen Elizabeth is Zooming
item.description: Queen Elizabeth II has made a video conferencing call as part of her royal duties for the first time ever.

item.title: Maldives lifts all restrictions for visitors
item.description: The Maldives is reopening to all visitors next month with no restrictions.

item.title: 'We're forgotten': Mexico City paramedics say the government isn't getting their backs
Japan's richest man: The very image of America is breaking
item.description: Tears in America's social fabric are having a devastating impact on retail business, according to Japan's richest man, Tadashi Yanai. The CEO of Fast Retailing, which owns Uniqlo, said his business reopened after the Covid-19 shutdown, but protests in the US have doubled the economic pain. Journalist Kaori Enjoji reports.

item.title: Volkswagen made a racist ad. Here's why no one got fired
item.description: Volkswagen on Thursday blamed a "lack of sensitivity and procedural errors" for its failure to prevent the creation and publication of a racist video but resisted calls to fire those responsible.

item.title: Statue of Scouts founder to be removed. Who is Robert Baden-Powell and why is he controversial?
item.description: A statue of Scouts founder Robert Baden-Powell will be removed from a quayside in Dorset, southern England, as the UK continues to reckon with monuments of its imperialist past.

item.title: Model reveals racist and transphobic abuse she's received since L'Oreal appointment
item.description: British model Munroe Bergdorf has said her social media messages have been "flooded" by racist and transphobic abuse since she announced she will join L'Oreal's UK diversity board.

item.title: There's no pause button for these 3 security threats in the US
item.description: When the United States emerges from the Covid-19 public health crisis, its national security will need time to recover before operating at full strength again.

item.title: German prosecutors say they have new evidence in Madeleine McCann case, but not enough
item.description: German prosecutors have said they have evidence that a man jailed for another crime killed British toddler Madeleine McCann 13 years ago -- just not enough to charge the suspect in court.

item.title: 'Revenge spending' in China is giving luxury brands some hope
item.description: Chinese shoppers are finally starting to snap up high-end handbags, shoes and jewelry again, giving the luxury goods industry hope that a recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is on the way.

item.title: India's richest city should have been its most prepared for coronavirus. So why does Mumbai have the country's highest infection rate?
item.description: India's richest city is buckling under the weight of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Rights group says Zoom shut down its account after Tiananmen Square anniversary event
item.description: A US-based group supporting human rights in China says it is "outraged" that the video conferencing company Zoom temporarily shut down its account after it held an event on the platform in remembrance of the Tiananmen Square massacre.

item.title: 'All Lives Matter' protesters in New Jersey re-enacted Floyd's death in front of Black Lives Matter march
item.description: A group of people mockingly reenacted George Floyd's death at an "All Lives Matter" protest in front of a Black Lives Matter march on Monday in Franklinville, New Jersey.

item.title: The pandemic has robbed us of the benefits of human touch
Banksy artwork stolen from Paris' Bataclan theater is found in Italy
item.description: Italian police have found a Banksy artwork that was stolen from outside the Bataclan theater in Paris last year.

item.title: 'Enigmatic' footprints reveal prehistoric crocodile that walked on two legs
item.description: Ancient footprints embedded in rock in South Korea likely belonged to a prehistoric crocodile that walked on two legs. It's the first time this gait has been found in this family of ancient crocs, which typically walked on four legs like modern-day crocodiles and alligators.

item.title: The Tamagotchi virtual pet from the 90s is back
item.description: The Tamagotchi is back.

item.title: Ex-NFL star 'honors' Matthew McConaughey for fronting up to talk about race
item.description: "How can I do better as white man," actor Matthew McConaughey recently asked Emmanuel Acho as part of the former NFL star's YouTube series "Uncomfortable Conversations with a Black Man."

item.title: IOC pledges to work with athletes on relaxing Olympic protest policy
item.description: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is consulting the organization's Athletes' Commission before deciding whether to relax its stance against protests.

item.title: Can this super-simple device stop virus spreading on airplanes?
item.description: It's not flashy or futuristic-looking, but it's simple, cheap and apparently effective: British aircraft interior company RAS Completions says its new personal protection shield could help protect fliers from Covid-19.

item.title: Architects have designed a Martian city for the desert
item.description: Dubai is a city where firefighters use jetpacks, archipelagos are built from scratch, and buildings climb into the clouds; a slick metropolis in the middle of a vast red desert. First-time visitors would be forgiven for thinking they had stumbled onto a film set for a sci-fi movie.

item.title: See global design competition to help fight Covid-19
item.description: From soap tattoos to self-cleaning lockers, top colleges have submitted proposals to combat the Coronavirus in an emergency edition of Art Dubai Group's Global Grad Show.

item.title: 13-0: The scoreline that shook the 2019 Women's World Cup
item.description: One year ago, when the final whistle blew in Stade Auguste-Delaune in France the scoreline sent shockwaves around the world: 13 goals to the US Women's National Team, none to Thailand.

item.title: 'Gone With the Wind' temporarily pulled from HBO Max
item.description: HBO Max has temporarily pulled "Gone With the Wind" from its library due to "racist depictions." The 1939 film will eventually return to the service with "a denouncement of those very depictions."

item.title: US government spy planes monitored George Floyd protests
item.description: A small Cessna Citation jet flying straight into Washington's highly restricted airspace would typically be met with fighter jets on its wing. But when one flew over the nation's capital on June 1 and circled the White House 20 times, it was hardly an accident.

item.title: Cuomo supports New York's Christopher Columbus statuef
Trump's press secretary claims Juneteenth is 'meaningful' to him. Others see a racist play
item.description: • Analysis: Why Trump's rally will be a disaster

item.title: 'Be very careful. I love you all,' said a veteran doctor to his wife. He died from Covid-19 days later.
item.description: • Analysis: Trump says Covid-19 reduced to 'ashes'. Data doesn't

item.title: CNN debuts its 2020 Electoral College map
item.description: There are many more unknowns than knowns nearly five months prior to Election Day 2020.

item.title: Moderna expects to begin phase 3 Covid-19 vaccine trial soon
Xi appears to make alarming moves
item.description: As the world is distracted by the Covid-19 pandemic, China appears to be making bold military moves on multiple fronts, causing experts to warn of the tension between the US and China. CNN's David Culver reports.
